p: The identification of individuals with recent infection was based on a HCV antibody avidity assay using diethylamine (DEA) as a chaotropic agent[ 55]. An avidity index was calculated by determining the percentage that the DEA reduces in optical density of the sample in comparison to a paired non-treated well. An avidity index <30% was considered recently infected. The algorithm for defining recent HCV infection was an avidity index <30% and a positive HCV RNA viral load. We used a method where individuals appeared recently infected for a mean of 147 days after seroconversion and < 1% of 579 chronically infected individuals (>2 years post infection) were misclassified[ 55]. The false recent rate used was 1.1%, properly adjusted for the HIV prevalence of the cohort[ 55].
